page.title: 06THE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content:
{Tudor grammar schools}were founded in both{Alton and Farnham}and the church was the source of any primary teaching in the village. Bentley had its own {Dame School(s)}giving rudimentary education to farmworkers children. The records of Vestry Meetings show that in{1797 a "school of industry"}was supported where girls were taught to knit gloves.
{In 1842 the Bishop of Winchester } {granted one half acre "for a school} {for poor persons".}When enlarged in 1913 to its present size on the same site it was necessary to move the children from the site while work took place. During this period the{children were{taught in a new hop kiln}kindly loaned by a local farmer. A proposal to modernise the school will mean a similar evacuation.{Where to in 1986?}
